node.title: 'We need to investigate all possibilities' - Police dive squad
node.description: The police dive squad will this morning join the operation to locate the final missing person from the tragic North Cape boating incident on Sunday. Audio

node.title: Watch: NZ pledges another $5m to support Ukraine and give military aid
node.description: The New Zealand Government has agreed to send non-lethal military equipment to Ukraine, such as military body armour, helmets and vests.

node.title: Nuclear disaster fears raise the stakes in Ukraine invasion
node.description: For more than three decades, very little has disturbed the Chernobyl exclusion zone, the site of the worst nuclear accident in human history - until Russia invaded Ukraine.

node.title: Called out by Zelenskyy, Nestle defends its Russia business
node.description: In a speech streamed to protesters in Switzerland, Ukraine's president singles out Swiss food company for refusing to exit.

node.title: "West Side Story" star says she wasn't invited to the Oscars
node.description: "I'm disappointed too," Zegler said. "But that's okay. So proud of our movie."

node.title: Girl who sang "Let It Go" in Ukraine bomb shelter performs for thousands
node.description: Thousands of people waved lights in the darkened stadium as 7-year-old Amellia Anisovych sang Ukraine's anthem.

node.title: Armstrong's puts brakes on share float
node.description: One of the country's biggest car dealers, Armstrong's, has put plans for a share float on hold because of financial market uncertainty.

node.title: DHB boss expects Canterbury Covid-19 cases to peak this week
node.description: In the South Island, 462 Canterbury District Health Board staff members are away because of Covid-19.

node.title: Wellington Water under the pump over poor condition of network assets
node.description: While Wellington Water is falling short in the capital city, other councils in the region say they are managing the water company just fine because they are spending more.

node.title: Mandates, vaccine passes and traffic light system up for review today
node.description: Covid-19 restrictions look set to be relaxed in the coming weeks as the Omicron outbreak plateaus and the border begins to reopen.

node.title: Fonterra to 'exit its business' in Russia following the invasion of Ukraine
node.description: Fonterra is closing its Moscow office, and has withdrawn from its joint venture with Unifood in Russia, established more than three years ago.

node.title: Hamish Kerr makes history with medal at World Indoor Champs
node.description: Hamish Kerr has finished third at the World Indoor Athletics championship in Serbia, becoming the first New Zealander to win a global high jump medal.

node.title: Meta involved in "extremist activities," Russian court rules
node.description: The ruling applies to Facebook and Instagram, but spares WhatsApp, according to Russian news source Novaya Gazette.

node.title: The secrets to saving money at the pump by "hyper-miling" on the road
node.description: Wayne Gerdis said his slow and steady approach to driving has been getting him well over 80 miles per gallon, saving him about $2,500 a year.

node.title: Editor calls reporter to cover shooting, not realizing she'd been killed
node.description: Sierra Jenkins, 25, who covered education for The Virginian-Pilot of Norfolk, died after the shooting outside Chicho's Pizza Backstage.

node.title: Ferrari's Leclerc wins F1 opener
node.description: Charles Leclerc embarked on F1's new era in triumphant style, leading team mate Carlos Sainz in a one-two for a resurgent Ferrari in the season-opening Bahrain Grand Prix.

node.title: White couple charged with hate crime in alleged murder of Black man
node.description: Images released by the San Joaquin County prosecutor show one of the suspects has apparent white supremacist tattoos

node.title: West Papua students in dire straits after Indonesia cuts funding
node.description: Students from West Papua are facing a difficult time in New Zealand after Indonesia said it would no longer fund their scholarships and wanted them repatriated home.

node.title: Russia's war in Ukraine has driven 10 million people from their homes
node.description: At least 3.5 million of those made homeless by Vladimir Putin's aerial assault and ground invasion have left the country entirely.

node.title: Ukrainian mother wounded while shielding baby from blast
node.description: The mother, named Olga, who was wounded in her head, shared what she thinks kept her baby alive.

node.title: Watch Live: Ketanji Brown Jackson's Supreme Court confirmation hearings begin
node.description: Jackson's four-day confirmation hearings begin 24 days after she was announced as President Biden's historic nominee to the Supreme Court.

node.title: Accused Gov. Whitmer kidnap plot leader asked: "When's the lynching?"
node.description: The disclosure came near the end of the first phase of testimony by a key government witness in the trial of four men.

node.title: Boater rescues man from lake, then fatally shoots him
node.description: The woman who was with Nathan Drew Morgan pushed him back into the lake in an attempt to defuse the situation, but he was later shot.

node.title: David Beckham hands over Instagram account to doctor in Ukraine
node.description: Iryna gave a first-person account of what it's like inside a perinatal center during the war in Ukraine.

node.title: Full transcript of "Face the Nation" on March 20, 2022
node.description: On this "Face the Nation" broadcast, Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin and Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell join Margaret Brennan.

node.title: Treasure hunters: Did FBI destroy video of fabled Civil War gold?
node.description: The FBI's contractor said it detected a 9-ton metallic mass suggestive of gold, according to an FBI affidavit unsealed last year.

node.title: Saudi Arabia says it's not responsible for high oil prices
node.description: An attack by Yemen's Houthi rebels over the weekend reduced production at a key petrochemical plant.

node.title: Shooting at Arkansas car show kills at least 1, wounds 27
node.description: One person was in custody and authorities were searching for others who may have fired into the crowd Saturday evening, police said.

node.title: Tesla jump stunt sparks anger in L.A.
node.description: Viral LAPD video compiled from some taken by resident shows a Tesla flying through the air past onlookers after launching itself just after midnight. Police say the rented Tesla was left at the scene.

node.title: GOP backing aggressive policy toward Ukraine, breaking with Trump
node.description: Few Republicans are echoing Trump's description of the Russian president​ as savvy or smart.
